nodes.documentation:
@dev    This contract implements the ERC223 token, and requires the token
        handling contracts to include tokenFallback function. We emit
        each Transfer event after successly making a transfer.

 *         Notice that this contract does not provide any reclaim functions
        for Ether, thus for market stable reason, any Ether sent to this
        contract in exchange for the ERC223 token will be burned.
nodes.name: ERC223

nodes.documentation:
@dev     Constructor for the ERC223 token.
         All the totalSupply, remainingSupply, price are hard coded.
         totalSupply:    Total supply is 21,000,000, with the initiator to be the contract owner
         owner:          Contract owner is the caller.
         price:          One Ether (or 1e18 Wei) worth 100 our ERC223 token
                         Thus one of our token worth 1e16 Wei

isRegistered

devdoc.details: This contract implements the ERC223 token, and requires the token        handling contracts to include tokenFallback function. We emit        each Transfer event after successly making a transfer.  *         Notice that this contract does not provide any reclaim functions        for Ether, thus for market stable reason, any Ether sent to this        contract in exchange for the ERC223 token will be burned.

balanceOf(string).details: Query the balance of the person.

params.who: The person that account balance will be checked.

balanceOf(string).return: The balance of the address relates to the person.

constructor.details: Constructor for the ERC223 token.         All the totalSupply, remainingSupply, price are hard coded.         totalSupply:    Total supply is 21,000,000, with the initiator to be the contract owner         owner:          Contract owner is the caller.         price:          One Ether (or 1e18 Wei) worth 100 our ERC223 token                         Thus one of our token worth 1e16 Wei

isRegistered(string,address).details: Check if the name and address pair is registered.

params.addr: The address relate to the name.
params.name: The name bind to the address.

isRegistered(string,address).return: true if the name address pair exists.

registerMe(string).details: Register the sender address with the given name mapping to address.

params.myName: The name that we want the message sender address bind to.

registerMe(string).return: ture if the binding is successful.

transfer(string,string,uint256).details: This tranfer function is for backward compatibility with ERC20 standard.

params.from: The address that sends the funds.
params.to: The address that receives the funds.

transfer(string,string,uint256,bytes).details: This is the main transfer function for ERC223 standard.

params.data: The metadata been sent along with the transaction.
params.from: The address that sends the funds.
params.to: The address that receives the funds.
